values:
got a talent for getting myself into trouble.

4 a.m. silverlake resevoir driving driving the smell of him still on me. strokes blaring.  making sense of it all.  it making no sense whatsoever.  then sufjan stevens comes on and it makes more sense.  but by now i'm over it. 

making phone calls but no one's picking up.  scribbling notes explaining, explaining why i had to bail.  why i'm driving around at 4 a.m. the vodka still in my system.  happy birthday to me.  in my pajamas.  eyes dry.  slitted and focus.  focus.

focus.

i walked out there.  i smoked a cigarette.  she had her arm around me.  he looked at me.  she said something.  he sneered.  she helped me with him.  i helped him with him.  eventually he just walked away.  looked back.  turned to look at me.  but just walked away.

i fell asleep waiting for him.  he seemed distracted.  i didn't care.  

i didn't care.  and maybe i should have.

maybe he should have.

and now i'm under the bridge and over the bridge and over the fence there it goes.
there it goes.

there i go.

it slipped gently from his lips...between kisses...
after he had bit my lower lip, but before i ran my nose over his.
the hibernating poet had emerged.
in a whisper, when i least expected it.
when i most needed it.

his slippery, slim body beneath mine.
my hair in his face.  tracing scars with my fingertips.
the benign tranformed to embellish harmless memories.
scars and marks.  .

those shadowed eyes closed.  lids against my lips.
my hands in his soft, soft hair.
murmuring.  murmuring my feelings he looks me in the eye.

i run scenarios through my head.  waiting, waiting for him to
reduce me into a pile of ash--burning for him, the smoldering
put out only by the blood that seeps out of my shattered
heart--still beating against the tapping of his fingers on
my ribcage.

his hand lingering on one breast.
i grasp him as he tenses beneath me.
we are all mouths and fingers
all affected syllables and sighs.

his hand on my ass all night.
our bodies regulating the other's temperature.
he burns me u.  i cool his heat.
